message.content: This question requires knowledge about weathering processes. When a person wants to make a rock look different, they can put it in a tumbler. A tumbler is a machine that uses friction to wear down the rock and give it a weathered appearance. Option (A) is incorrect because simply putting the rock in a bag will not cause weathering. Option (B) is incorrect because putting the rock in a yard will not cause weathering unless there are specific weathering agents present (such as rain, wind, etc.). Option (C) is incorrect because putting the rock in a dish will not cause any weathering.

This question requires some basic knowledge about weathering and the processes that can alter the appearance of a rock. Option (D) is the correct answer because putting a rock in a tumbler involves subjecting it to the repetitive action of rolling and tumbling, which can cause abrasion and weathering. Option (B), putting it in a yard, does not specify any particular actions that would weather the rock. Option (C), putting it in a dish, also does not involve any processes that would cause weathering.
